metadata.description:
I first wrote "Alexandrine" while I was departing a long term relationship.  I linked up with one of my favorite producers /good friend Mark Evans to assist on instrumentation and production.  We released it fast and low key.  Not even a week after the release, our friend Grabbitz sent us this remix he titled "Grabbitz 1994 Version" -- which is a very sweet and subtle take on the original with added percussions and backing vocals.  Needless to say I was obsessed.  In fact, I was so excited that I forgot to release it.  But now feels like a good time.

Mark Evans and Grabbitz first ever NFT release btw :)

lyrics.text:
I thought that we could have it all
I did my best I had my faults and
maybe we just didn't fit at all
I should have saw it coming first
We held on til the bubble burst and
Guess we didn't stand a chance at all

I thought maybe we could be together
forever's a long way away
Thank you for the memories
I can't say I wish you would stay

Wake up in the afternoon
Only getting half of you and
Try a couple times and then hit snooze

What am I supposed to do?
I can't force the love out of you

Coz I can't be like Alexandrine
Coz I can't be like Alexandrine
Coz I can't be like Alexandrine
Coz I can't be like Alexandrine

I thought maybe we could be together

metadata.name: Alexandrine (Grabbitz 1994 Version)  #1
metadata.title: Alexandrine (Grabbitz 1994 Version)
